intro: Holosteum umbellatum var. oligandrum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf holosteum, is a flowering plant species native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or inland areas with well-drained conditions. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is known for its delicate appearance and adaptability to arid environments. The variety oligandrum is distinguished by its reduced number of flowers per inflorescence compared to the typical form.
